chapter_title: 20. But if neither time nor place be known, then the left
claims: If neither time nor place is known, the left wing will be impotent to succor the right, and vice versa.
The furthest portions of the army should not be more than a hundred LI apart, and even the nearest should not be separated by several LI.
rules: Victory can be achieved despite having fewer soldiers if one discovers the enemy's plans and vulnerable spots.
Rouse the enemy to learn their principle of activity or inactivity and force them to reveal themselves.
Carefully compare the opposing army with your own to know where strength is superabundant and where it is deficient.
